This is a specific type of encephalitis that is caused by the production of autoantibodies against the NMDA receptors in the brain.

In the given paragraph, the presence of low-titre NMDA receptor antibodies in the patient suggests the possibility of anti-NMDA receptor encephalitis or another autoimmune disorder affecting the NMDA receptors. Therefore, while NMDA receptor antibodies are not a disease entity, they are relevant to the discussion of the patient's condition and may indicate an underlying disease process.
